body.name: WOWNOVA English Version Computer Temp Monitor, PC Sensor Panel Display, PC Temperature Display for PC ARGB Computer Case Secondary Screen, IPS USB Mini Screen PC CPU RAM HDD Data Monitor
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 4 hrs 16 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 46 mins
features: 【With software in English】 The PC Temperature Display works creat with our English version software. You can use this with our software as a "second monitor" to view computer's Temperature and usage of CPU, GPU ,RAM and HDD Data etc.

【Only Use with single USB-C cable】Our Computer Temp Monitor only needs the single USB-C cable so it can be mounted completely internally off a usb header without the need of a port on the GPU which is a huge plus to you. No HDMI required, no power required.
【Great Viewing Angles & Accurate Information】 IPS full view. 3.5inch mini screen. Display area: 1.93*2.91". Overall size: 2.17*3.35". Resolution: 320*480. Thickness: 0.31". Shell material: metal

【Simple and Feature-rich】Customizable screen layout. Horizontal and vertial screen switching. Visual theme editor: drag the mouse arbitarily to realize your creativity. Energy saving & environmental protection. Turn off the screen automatically and Comfortable eye protection Brightness adjustment.

【Great Customer Service】We respect and value each customer's product and service satisfaction. We want to offer you premium products for a Long-Lasting Experience. If any issue, please kindly contact us for a solution.
body.description: Explation of the data discrepancies Some customers compare the data of our pc temps monitor with data of task manager or other software. Found that the data is inconsistent, so question whether our data is accurate. The explanation is shown on the picture. Offcial software shows a CPU utilization rate of 7%. Our screen shows a CPU utilization rate of 7%. The task manager shows 23%, which is higher and different from the Offcial. Therefore, if there is a data discrepancy. Please use WOWNOVA screen as standard data!!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Explation of the data discrepancies Some customers compare the data of our pc temps monitor with data of task manager or other software. Found that the data is inconsistent, so question whether our data is accurate. The explanation is shown on the picture. Offcial software shows a CPU utilization rate of 7%. Our screen shows a CPU utilization rate of 7%. The task manager shows 23%, which is higher and different from the Offcial. Therefore, if there is a data discrepancy. Please use WOWNOVA screen as standard data!!

Q&A 1.How to start: (No need for AIDA64) A. Please unzip our software zip file to a folder B. Connect to computer via data cable → Right-click “Usb Monitor.exe” → and click “run as administrator" C. Select Theme → Click “Run" 2. Why does the graphics card data not move? Usually notebook users, the independent display is usually on standby, and only the core display is used to save energy, while the secondary screen monitors the more important independent display, so of course the graphics card monitoring data does not move. 3. Can other content be displayed? No, only the content set by the custom software can be displayed 4.USB interface version? USB1.0, USB2.0, USB3.0 are not limited, as long as it is USB 5. HOW TO AUTO START? Please note that it can auto-start: click “Normal Setting” → Click “Auto Start” → Click “Save” 6.Detailed reading of the manual and operation video can help you solve most of the issues. Any issues cannot be solved, please contact WOWNOVA directly. OTHER SIZES 2.1/5/7/8.8/12.6-inch WOWNOVA Computer temp monitor sensor panel please refer below ↓↓↓ ↓↓↓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little monitor, but a bit wonky.
reviews.reviewText: The software was a bit suspect, but after seeing a decompiled version online (you can google), there wasn't anything that would worry about ( backdoors, etc ). It comes with alot of skins, but you can create and design your own, but be aware it takes a bit of skill.Also, I used some camera mounting bits to align it up and hide the cables for a clean look. Very nice!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No Support From WOWNOVA!!!
reviews.reviewText: Can't find any way to contact WOWNOVA for support. The 3.5 display worked for a short time, but now only backlit when run is selected from the software. Tested on several different PCs and get the same. None of the troubleshooting suggesting work either. This was a huge waste of time and money, especially without any form of real support or trouble shooting. I'm very disappointed and will never buy or recommend any product from WOWNOVA!Sincerely, David A. Hensel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great little monitor
reviews.reviewText: I love this little guy! Very easy to get going, plugged it in and it was recognized by my 3.x usb right away. Ran the software* and picked out the theme i liked. Easy as that. I went with the "note" theme, cause it went well with my case motiff.That said it does come with a good selection of layouts and themes. However this 3" version is alittle hampered by it's size when it comes to the themes. Some are hard to see, especially if the unit is tucked away. You can edit them, and make your own, however the instructions and even the software is poorly translated. Thats why i took a star off and gave it 4. Again though, the software is easy to run, just the theme editing is trial and error.All said its a great simple to us monitor that really makes your case stand out.i like it soo much i ordered the 5" version for my other build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little monitor display
reviews.reviewText: Love it! Nice, vivid display and was easy to install. It doesn't come with anyway to mount it to flat surfaces so make sure you have some double sided tape or similar if you plan to do that. I used a 10pin internal USB to USB female adapter to power it from inside my case. The software is pretty messy, but there's an alternative open source version that's a little nicer. In both cases though, making the theme was a bit confusing but once you figure it out it's easy to make whatever you want. I have it displaying CPU and GPU load and temps, volume, network usage, plus my time. It can display weather too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Raptor Lake processor?
reviews.reviewText: Appears to have a compatibility issue with a Raptor Lake processor. When I first installed and ran the software, a message popped up regarding an issue with my I7 13700K Raptor Lake processor. I'm at work and can't recall the exact message but there appeared to be a need to update the software to accommodate the latest architecture. It runs fine for a few minutes then shuts down.For those asking about downloading the software, the instructions come with a QR code that provides the link to it. There is also a URL link but the instructions are mostly in Chinese. The software links do have english versions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Works....when it wants to...
reviews.reviewText: You have a 50/50 chance of this thing working, every time you plug it in. 90% of the time, I see the "run application" notice - WHILE THE APP IS RUNNING!The "software" that you have to download from a random website, that if you don't type the Bit.ly link in correctly, will take you to a dozen different websites, before you've even found the manufacturer's website - just list the actual website, not some BS bitly link, because you're too cheap to print the full site.GPU's - you CAN NOT select which GPU you want this thing to monitor, it will monitor whichever one it wants - (and changes which it's monitoring, seemingly at random), and you just have to deal with it.As "customizable" as they say the software is, it's still too dumb to allow you to ACTUALLY select which GPU you're monitoring, which was MOST of the reason for me buying it in the first place - need to monitor the RTX 3060 in my laptop for temperature, but this thing, wants to monitor the onboard graphics instead.Just use the resource monitor in the task manager, THAT actually shows accurate, USEFUL information, THIS device, was a waste of money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Little Gadget for Enthusiast.
reviews.reviewText: I build my own rigs and work on friends rigs. I'm more of a hobbyist that an expert. After blowing up my first rig due to over heating I decided I needed some sort of dashboard to keep an eye on my system. This little gadget is great for at a glance monitoring of the system. It comes with a small downloadable utility and once installed it works great. There's just one thing. The face indicates that I have an intel CPU and a Strix GPU. I have AMD throughout.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not accurate at all
reviews.reviewText: Temp readings do not match what my system is producing. This freezes and needs to be rebooted a lot. Has the option to display local weather which I thought was cool. Except even after setting my location, it doesn't work either.
